item.title: Webfonts in ggplot2
item.description:
Thanks to Hadley’s ggplot2 package, we are no longer confined to base graphics plots in R. However, by default all fonts are generated using the ‘Helvetica’ family. Now this is a great sans serif font, as evidenced by the fact that it is use literally everywhere in everything.

But now that we have these incredible graphical capabilities, and the ability to produce FiveThirtyEight quality figures, we should really explore how to enhance our plots further with the use of better fonts.
